page.title: 01General
page.content: Milburn is a small isolated village on the Cumbrian Eastern Fellside, lying underneath Cross Fell and Great Dun Fell. It forms part of a chain of Fellside villages running from Appleby,north to Brampton,near Carlisle. Amongst these it is unique in that nearly all its houses look out onto the village green and onto the school which is situated at the top of the village. Perhaps on account of its isolated location,Milburn has a very strong community spirit and its school is one of the fundamental pillars of this community. It is a fortified village with 2 Gin Cases,l Maypole, Village Hall, Church, Chapel,Village Shop and Antique Shop.It has been designated a conserved village.
